data.question: What is the chemical formula of the compound that exhibited reversible multi-phase transitions?
data.answer: {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH

data.question: What external stimuli were used to induce phase transitions in the compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH?
data.answer: Thermal treatment, photo-irradiation, and rapid cooling.

data.question: True or False: The compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH changes its electronic states by applying external stimuli.
data.answer: True

data.question: What phenomenon is observed when the temperature-dependent magnetic susceptibility measurements were carried out on polycrystalline samples of {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH?
data.answer: Thermal hysteresis over a temperature width of 12 K.

data.question: What role do hydrogen-bonding interactions play in the compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH?
data.answer: They are critical in tuning the redox potential of the Fe1 ion.

data.question: True or False: The desolvated form of {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH demonstrated electron transfer-coupled spin transition (ETCST) behavior.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the effect of 946 nm light irradiation on the compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH?
data.answer: It induces electron transfer from FeII to CoIII ions, converting the ground LT phase to the metastable HT* phase.

data.question: What happens to the dielectric constant of {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH during the transition from HT to LT phases?
data.answer: It changes drastically, indicating a remarkable increase.

data.question: True or False: The compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH exhibits single-chain magnet (SCM) behavior after 946 nm light irradiation.
data.answer: True

data.question: What structural change occurs in {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH upon photo-irradiation?
data.answer: The orthorhombic Pnma space group changes to the monoclinic P21/n space group.

data.question: True or False: The HTsc phase of {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH is achieved by gradually cooling the compound from ambient temperature to 30 K.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the space group change in {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH when rapidly cooled from ambient temperature to 30 K?
data.answer: It indicates the trapping of the supercooled phase (HTsc).

data.question: True or False: The HTsc phase of {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH exhibits stronger magnetic interactions than the LT phase.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of the asymmetric [Fe2Co] unit in the compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH?
data.answer: It is crucial for achieving multi-phase transitions and multi-switches adjusted by selective metal-to-metal electron transfer.

data.question: True or False: The compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH can function as a switch, sensor, and memory device due to its electronic state conversions.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the effect of removing uncoordinated methanol molecules from {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH?
data.answer: It results in the absence of electron transfer-coupled spin transition (ETCST) behavior.

data.question: True or False: The compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH exhibits a dielectric anomaly due to the motions of polar molecules.
data.answer: False

data.question: What is the significance of the selective electron transfer in {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH?
data.answer: It leads to a large dielectric response due to the change in the orientation of dipole moments.

data.question: True or False: The compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH demonstrates reversible phase transitions between high-temperature (HT) and low-temperature (LT) phases.
data.answer: True

data.question: What is the role of interchain C-H···π interactions in the compound {[(Tp)Fe(CN)3]2Co(BIT)} · 2CH3OH?
data.answer: They are responsible for the first-order phase transition and supercooled phenomenon.
